characters: CROSS-DISSOLVE TO NICK AND HOPPS WALKING IN THE RAINFORES
WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A festival replete with food booths, games and rides-- al aggressively carrot-themed. Judy, in her Cop Costume, bou along with her folks. We catch their conversation mid-str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, you ever wonder how your mom and me got to be so darn happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we gave up on our dreams and we settled, right Bon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, that's right, Stu. We settled hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's the beauty of complacency, Jude. If you don't try anything new, you'll never fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like trying, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What your father means, hon, is it's gonna be difficult-- impossible even-- for you to become a police officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. There's never been a bunny cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunnies don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Then I guess I'll have to be the first one. Because I am gonna make the world... (parkours against a vendor's stand) A better place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OR... um, heck, you wanna talk about making the world a better place-- The trio arrives at the Hopps Family Farm carrot booth, w is manned by too many children to count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --no better way to do it than becoming a carrot farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Your dad, me, your 275 brothers and sisters-- we're changing the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One carrot at a time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen to that. Carrot farming is a noble profession. Judy spots GIDEON GREY stalking some SMALL ANIMALS. She remains fixed on Gideon as Stu and Bonnie yap on obliviou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm. Just putting the seeds in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, at one with the soil. We're back on Bonnie and Stu's conversation now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get it. I mean, it's great to have dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just as long as you don't believe in em too much. (finally noticing Judy's absence) Where in the heck'd she go? ACROSS THE FAIR... From behind a tree, Judy watches as Gi Grey intimidates the astronaut sheep, SHARLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your tickets right now, or I'm gonna kick your meek little sheep butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Cut it out, Gideon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baa-baa. What're ya gonna do, cry? Gideon swipes Sharla's fair tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Judy charges toward the danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard her. Cut it out. Gideon turns. There's Judy, projecting the image of a tin Clint Eastwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice costume, loser. What crazy world are you living in where you think a bunny could be a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kindly return my friends' tickets. Gideon pats the tickets in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come and get `em.... But watch out, `cause I'm a fox-- and like you said in your dumb little stage play, us predators used to eat prey. And that killer instinct's still in our Dunnahh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Gideon) Uh, I'm pretty much sure it's pronounced D-N-A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what I know, Travis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't scare me, Gideon. Gideon shoves Judy. Hard. She falls. The other prey anima flee to safety behind a nearby tree, leaving her to face thugs alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared now? Judy starts to tear up. Her nose starts to twitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit her nose twitch. She is scared!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cry little baby bunny. Cry, cry -- Suddenly-- BAM! Judy kicks Gideon in the face with her hi legs. He stumbles back, then checks his lip for blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't know when to quit, do ya? He unsheathes his claws like a switchblade, then slaps he drawing blood from her cheek. She cowers, as do her scare friends behind the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to remember this moment-- the next time you think you will ever be anything more than just a stupid, carrot farming dumb bunny. Gideon and his pal head off, laughing and high-fiving. Th prey animals run back over to Judy, who wipes the blood f her cheek. She fights tears, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That looks bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Yeah, I'm okay. Judy smiles and then whips out the tickets as she gets up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! You got our tickets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're awesome, Judy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! That Gideon Grey doesn't know what he's talkin' `bout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he was right about one thing... Judy picks up the cop hat, puts it on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know when to quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps and the comparatively huge CADETS sit in a circle a MAJOR FRIEDKIN, an intimidating drill instructor, lecture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up Cadets! Zootopia has 12 unique ecosystems within its city limits-- Tundra Town, Sahara Square, Rainforest District, to name a few. You're gonna have to master all of them before you hit the streets-- or guess what? (to Hopps) You'll be dead!

dialogues.speaker: IN SAHARA SQUARE SIMULATOR
dialogues.text: Hopps struggles through the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scorching sandstorm. You're dead, bunny bumpkin!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VINE-COVERED MONKEY BARS
dialogues.text: Hopps swings across the bars, simulating the RAINFOREST DISTRICT. She falls off, landing face first in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1000 foot fall. You're dead, carrot face!

dialogues.speaker: TUNDRA TOWN ICE WALL
dialogues.text: Judy and the cadets sprint toward the wall. The CLAWED ANIMALS dig into the ice wall. Hopps slides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frigid ice wall. You're dead, farm girl!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BOXING RING
dialogues.text: Hopps gets in the ring with a BIG BISON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E-normous criminal. Hopps gets punched in the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead! / Dead! / Dead!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TOILET
dialogues.text: Hopps ruses into a stall. The toilet is considerably larg than she is. She shuts the door. We see her climb up the toilet. In the next stall, we see the feet of a Hippo. Then, KERSPLASH! Hopps falls into the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy toilet. You're dead, fluff butt!

dialogues.speaker: HOPPS ON HER OWN--
dialogues.text: She runs at sunset-- after everyone else has called it a We HEAR the drill instructor's voice echoing in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just quit and go home, fuzzy bunny! Then those of her parents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's never been a bunny cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. Then Gideon's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a stupid, carrot farming dumb bunny.

dialogues.speaker: OVERNIGHT, IN THE BARRACKS
dialogues.text: Hopps stays up late studying, doing sit ups.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ICE WALL
dialogues.text: Hopps bounds up the wall, jumps off of the backs of the b animals and makes it over, impressing the Major Friedkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps dodges a few swings. The Bison misses. Hopps bounds over him and uses his momentum-- kicking his other hand i his face, knocking him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's graduation day. MAYOR LIONHEART is at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mayor of Zootopia, I am proud to announce that my Mammal Inclusion Initiative has produced its first police academy graduate. Judy stands proudly in her cop uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valedictorian of her class, ZPD's very first rabbit officer... Judy Hopps. Judy walks to the stage as those in attendance cheer-- he FAMILY chief among them. ASSISTANT MAYOR BELLWETHER appla She smiles at Judy, lost in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat) Assistant Mayor Bellwether? Her badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Yes right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Bellwether steps forward to pin Hopps' ZPD badge on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, it is my great privilege to officially assign you to the heart of Zootopia: Precinct One, City Center. Judy can barely contain her glee. Her parents are in shoc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Officer Hopps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you down. This has been my dream since I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know, it's a... It's a real proud day for us little guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bellwether, make room will ya? Come on. Lionheart shoves Bellwether out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Officer Hopps. Let's see those teeth! A group of PHOTOGRAPHERS aim their cameras. Lionheart ste in front of Bellwether, edging her out of the photo. The flashbulbs pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, Bonnie, and several SIBLINGS accompany Judy to the t station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're real proud of you, Judy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Scared, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, it's kind of a proud-scared combo. I mean, Zootopia. It's so far a away... It's such a big city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys-- I've been working for this my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know. And we're just a little excited for you, but terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And also bears. We have bears to fear, too. To say nothing of lions, and wolves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...weasels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play cribbage with a weasel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he cheats like there's no tomorrow. You know what, pretty much all predators-- and Zootopia's full of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scolding) Oh, Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And foxes are the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (retreating) Actually, your father does have a point there. It's in their biology. Remember what happened with Gideon Grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was 9. Gideon Grey was a jerk, who happened to be a fox. I know plenty of bunnies who are jerks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Yeah, we all do. Absolutely. But just in case, we made you a little care package to take with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I put some snacks in there. Stu begins pulling a bunch of PINK FOX DETERRENTS from a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fox deterrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that's safe to have there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fox repellent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the deterrent and the repellent. That's all she needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out! Stu removes a Fox Taser, fires it up. It sizzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for goodness sake. She has no need for a fox taser, Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh c'mon. When is there not a need for a fox taser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look-- I will take this to make you stop talking. Judy grabs the pink fox repellent from the bag as the tra pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific! Everyone wins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving-- Zootopia Express!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Gotta go. Bye! Judy heads for the train, head held high. No turning back Stu and Bonnie watch, both holding back tears. Suddenly, emotion catches up with Judy. She turns, runs back to her parents, hugs them tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you, too! One more squeeze, then Judy runs off and jumps on the tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh cripes, here come the waterworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Stu, pull it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Judy! I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye! As the train pulls away, her family runs next to it, wavi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye! Judy looks back as their faces recede into the distance. train blasts past Bunnyburrow, passing its exponentially increasing population sign. Judy pulls out her iPhone and clicks play... her new life about to begin and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hopps takes the train, it rounds a curve. She looks up Her eyes light up. There in the distance is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THE UNBELIEVABLE ANIMAL METROPOLIS of ZOOTOPIA, which comprised of amazing habitat "boroughs." The train whips

dialogues.speaker: TUNDRATOWN, SAVANNA CENTRAL, RAINFOREST DISTRICT,
dialogues.text: MEADOWLANDS, SAHARA SQUARE, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps spills out of the train... and we are now in a MULT SCALE ENVIRONMENT: everything from mice to elephants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps emerges into the main Zootopia central plaza. It's amazing, magnificent place. A JUMBOTRON featuring a gazelle pop star, GAZELLE, blares message in a loop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Gazelle. Welcome to Zootopia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DHARMA ARMADILLO, Hopps's older ARMADILLO LANDLADY, opens door to Hopps' new apartment-- which we can't see yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And welcome to the Grand Pangolin Arms. "Luxury Apartments with Charm." Hopps discovers the room is a tiny, crappy studio apartme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complimentary de-lousing once a month. (handing over the keys) Don't lose your key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! As Dharma leaves, Hopps' volatile, artsy NEIGHBORS, KUDU ORYX POOTOSSER, pass by in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi, I'm Judy! Your new neighbor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well we're loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't expect us to apologize for it. Before Hopps can respond, they're gone, leaving Hopps alo She looks around... blank-faced so it's tough to read her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greasy walls... rickety bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy neighbors... (big smile as she flops on the bed) I love it! As the shouting continues, she stretches out on her bed, exhausted but overjoyed.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Quick, rhythmic cuts of: - Alarm clock: Beep. Beep. Beep. - Dressing: Vest. Badge. Belt. On the bedside table sits the PINK FOX REPELLENT. Judy glances at it and smirks-- taking it would be silly-- she walks out of frame. HOLD on the table. One second. Then Judy's hand comes back into frame and grabs the Repellent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utter mayhem. COPS parade PERPS through the lobby-- one i wearing cuffs and a plastic (not scary) safety muzzle, he complains to the BEAR COP marching him by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! He bared his teeth first. We land at the front desk and find CLAWHAUSER, a PUDGY CHEETAH COP, happily eating a bowl of Lucky Chomps cereal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scuse me! Down here? Hi. Clawhauser leans over the desk to find Hopps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-M goodness! They really did hire a bunny. What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell ya, you are even cuter than I thought you'd be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little wince) Ooo, uh, you probably didn't know, but a bunny can call another bunny "cute," but when other animals do it, it's a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasps, realizing) I am so sorry. Me, Benjamin Clawhauser, the guy everyone thinks is just a flabby, donut-loving cop, stereotyping you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay-- oh, you've actually you've actually got a-- there's a-- in your neck-- the fold-- the-- there's-- Clawhauser removes a small donut from under some neck fat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there you went, you little dickens! He crams the donut into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly laughing) I should get to roll call, so... which way do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Bullpen's over there to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, thank you! Clawhauser watches admiringly as she heads to the bullpen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, wistful) Aw... That poor little bunny's gonna get eaten alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps enters the bullpen, by far the smallest animal in t room: rhinos, buffalo, hippos, elephants, etc. Hopps hold her paw out to a tough RHINO, MCHORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Officer Hopps. You ready to make the world a better place? McHorn gives Hopps a reluctant fist bump, nearly knocking off the chair.

dialogues.speaker: TEN HUT
dialogues.text: In walks CHIEF BOGO, a gruff CAPE BUFFALO. He takes the d Everyone snaps to attention and starts stomping the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Everybody sit. As Hopps sits, she disappears below the DESK that is mean for a rhino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got three items on the docket. First... we need to acknowledge the elephant in the room. (nods to ELEPHANT) Francine, happy birthday. An elephant, FRANCINE, blushes as other cops clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number two: There are some new recruits with us I should introduce. But I'm not going to, because I don't care. Finally... He turns to a push pin-pocked MAP that's covered in photo MISSING MAMMALS. Hopps's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We have 14 missing mammal cases. All predators, from a giant polar bear, to a teensy little otter. And City Hall is right up my tail to find them. This is priority number one. Assignments! HIGGINS hands Bogo a stack of CASE FILES. Bogo puts on hi reading glasses, examining the files as he assigns cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers Grizzoli, Fangmeyer, Delgato-- your teams take Missing Mammals from the Rainforest District. Officers McHorn, Rhinowitz, Wolfard, your teams take Sahara Square. Officers Higgins, Snarlov, Trunkaby: Tundratown. And finally, our first bunny, Officer Hopps. Hopps sits up, expectant but steely. Bogo looks at the fi case file in his hand. He takes a dramatic breath, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parking Duty. Dismissed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parking duty? (runs after Bogo) Uh, Chief? Chief Bogo? Bogo looks around... then down to find Hopps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you said there were 14 missing mammal cases?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can handle one. You probably forgot, but I was top of my class at the academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't forget. Just don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm not just some "token" bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then writing a hundred tickets a day should be easy. He goes, slamming the door behind him. Judy stomps her fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 tickets...? I'm not gonna write 100 tickets... I'm gonna write 200 tickets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then, to the closed door) Before noon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps dons a vest, buckles her seat belt, floors the peda and... takes off at 2 miles an hour. Which leads to a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps zooms past a row of cars, marking their tires. Crui the streets, her super-sensitive ears hear a meter ding. slams her brakes-- then proudly issues Ticket #1. Ding! Another meter goes off. Then another. And another. She's on a roll. She looks down at her counter. It's at 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom! 200 tickets before noon. A final ding... Reveal: her own traffic cart is at an exp meter. Hopps rolls her eyes and writes herself a ticket.
As Hopps puts the ticket on her windshield, she hears a v across the street:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, watch where you're going, Fox! Hopps looks across the street to see... a RED FOX. Hopps looks at him, a little suspicious. The Fox looks around, then slinks into a cafГ©. Hopps run across the street and peeks in the window. It's an ice cr parlor, but... the FOX IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Where'd he go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elephants scoop ice cream with their trunks, suck up nuts with their trunks. It's cute but also disgusting. As Hopp enters, she spots the fox, NICK WILDE, at the front of th line and overhears the proprietor, JERRY, addressing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I don't know what you're doing skulking around during daylight hours, but I don't want any trouble in here... So hit the road. Hopps unsnaps the holster of her PINK FOX REPELLENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not looking for any trouble either, sir. I simply want to buy a Jumbo Pop for my little boy. Ready for action, slowly creeping forward, Hopps's expres changes when she sees that Nick is with his TODDLER SON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boy) You want the red or the blue, pal? Staring at the cute little boy, Hopps is embarrassed by h impulse. She snaps the Repellent holster and begins to le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted with herself) I'm such a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, kid. Back up. Listen, buddy, what? There aren't any fox ice cream joints in your part of town? Hopps suddenly stops. Her ears go up and she turns around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no no, there are. There are. It's just, my boy-- (tousles boy's hair) --this goofy little stinker-- he loves all things elephant. Wants to be one when he grows up. The boy gives a TOOT-TOOT with his toy elephant trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it adorable? Who the heck am I to crush his little dreams, huh? Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you probably can't read, fox but the sign says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly reads SIGN, belittling)

dialogues.speaker: WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE
dialogues.text: SERVICE TO ANYONE. So beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're holding up the line. The little fox is about to cry, when Hopps walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're gonna have to wait your turn like everyone else, metermaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually... (revealing badge) I'm an officer. Just had a quick question. Are your customers aware they're getting snot and mucous with their cookies and cream? An ELEPHANT COUPLE overhear and spit out their ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't wanna cause you any trouble, but I believe scooping ice cream with an un-gloved trunk is a Class 3 Health Code Violation... A guilty EMPLOYEE releases a scoop from their trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Which is kind of a big deal. Of course-- I could let you off with a warning if you were to glove those trunks and, I don't know, finish selling this nice dad and his son a... what was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jumbo Pop. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jumbo Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stews for a beat, then) Fifteen dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. (to Hopps) Thank you. (then, digs for wallet) Oh no, are you kidding me? I don't have my wallet. I'd lose my head if it weren't attached to my neck, that's the truth. Oh boy, I'm sorry pal. Gotta be about the worst birthday ever. Please don't be mad at me. (kisses him, to Hopps) Thanks, anyway. He turns to go. Hopps slaps some money on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps has the Toddler's hand. Nick holds a HUGE JUMBO-POP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, I can't thank you enough. So kind, really, can I pay you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, my treat-- it just-- y'know, it burns me up to see folks with such backward attitudes toward foxes. I just wanna say, you're a great dad and just a... a real articulate fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, well, that is high praise. It's rare that I find someone so non- patronizing... Officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally misses his dig) Hopps. Mr...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilde. Nick Wilde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Toddler) And you little guy, you want to be an elephant when you grow up... you be an elephant-- because this is Zootopia, anyone can be anything. Hopps puts a STICKER BADGE on the boy's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, boy, I tell him that all the time. All right here ya go-- (hands him popsicle) Two paws. Yeah. Oh, look at that smile, that's a happy birthday smile! All right, give her a little bye-bye toot toot. The kid toots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toot, toot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye! Hopps walks off with a spring in her step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps continues to write tickets. As she leaves a ticket another car, she can see a few blocks away. It's NICK and KID. Hopps gives them a wave, but they don't notice her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Hey, little toot toot-- Hopps realizes they are melting their jumbo-pop in the ho sun, channeling the juice into jugs. Huh? Nick and his ki pack the jugs into a van and NICK'S SON gets in the drive seat. They drive off, passing Hopps, who stares, confused

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps follows them to... Tundratown, where Nick's "son" u his little paw prints to create molds they pour the popsi juice into, creating dozens of smaller popsicles. Hopps l on, scandalized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps watches them resell the "Pawpsicles" at marked-up prices to LEMMINGS... when one buys one, they all do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pawpsicles! Get your pawpsicles! Nick rakes in the cash. As the lemmings leave, they throw their used popsicle sticks into a RECYCLING BIN. A second later, Nick's "son," FINNICK, emerges from the bin with a bundle of used popsicle sticks. Hopps is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps watches Nick plop down a big bundle of USED POPSICL STICKS in front of a MOUSE CONSTRUCTION WORKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lumber delivery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The color? Uh... It's redwood. Hopps has now graduated to genuine anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick hands Finnick a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39...40. There you go. Way to work that diaper, big guy. Hey, no kiss bye-bye for daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (super-deep voice) You kiss me tomorrow, I'll bite your face off. Ciao. As Finnick drives off in his van, BLARING LOUD FRENCH RAP MUSIC. We discover HOPPS behind it, and she is not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I stood up for you, and you lied to me. You liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a hustle, sweetheart. And I'm not the liar, he is. Nick points behind Hopps. She turns... no one. She turns back. Nick is gone-- his tail disappears around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Nick walks on, calmly. Hopps hurries up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, slick Nick, you're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee I don't know, how `bout selling food without a permit, transporting undeclared commerce across borough lines, false advertising... Nick smiles and produces those documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permit. Receipt of declared commerce. And I didn't falsely advertise anything. Take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told that mouse the popsicle sticks were redwood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. "Red wood." With a space in the middle. Wood that is red. (then) You can't touch me, Carrots, I been doing this since I was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna wanna refrain from calling me Carrots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bad. I just naturally assumed you came from some little carrot- choked podunk, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (isn't it obvious?) Ah, no. Podunk is in Deerbrooke County, and I grew up in Bunnyburrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Tell me if this story sounds familiar: (harsher now, rapidly) NaГЇve little hick with good grades and big ideas decides, "Hey lookit me, I'm gonna move to Zootopia-- where Predators and Prey live in harmony and sing Kumbaya!" Only to find-- whoopsie, we don't all get along. And that dream of becoming a big city cop? Double whoopsie! She's a meter maid. And whoopsie number threesie-- NO ONE cares about her or her dreams. And soon enough those dreams die and our bunny sinks into emotional and literal squalor living in a box under a bridge. Til finally she has no choice but to go back home with that cute, fuzzy wuzzy little tail between her legs to become-- you're from Bunnyburrow, is that what you said?-- so how `bout a carrot farmer... That sound about right? She's speechless-- How did he get my number so quickly? A RHINO almost crushes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful now, it won't just be your dreams getting crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ever-so-slightly rattled) Hey! Hey! No one tells me what I can or can't be! Especially not some jerk who never had the guts to try to be anything more than a popsicle hustler!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright look, everyone comes to Zootopia thinking they can be anything they want. Well you can't. You can only be what you are. (points to himself) Sly fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to her) Dumb bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am NOT a dumb bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And that's not wet cement. She looks down. She's landed in wet cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes) You'll never be a real cop. You're a cute meter maid though. Maybe a supervisor one day. Hang in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HER WELCOME MAT: Hopps wipes off her cement cove feet. Then she enters

dialogues.speaker: THE APARTMENT --
dialogues.text: Hopps turns on the radio. Everybody Hurts plays. She chan the station. A sadder song comes on. She changes the stat repeatedly, each song progressively sadder. Finally, she lands on a treacly instrumental that will score the scene She puts in a microwave dinner: CARROTS FOR ONE. Hopps ta her food (A SINGLE CARROT) and sits at a small table. Her phone rings. INSERT: MOM & DAD FACETIME. Hopps sh head, sighs, then puts on a fake smile and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey, it's my parents!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw there she is! Hi sweetheart! THE FACETIME cuts between Bonnie on her phone. Stu will p in and out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Jude the Dude! How was your first day on the force?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was real great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Everything you ever hoped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Absolutely. And more. Everyone's so nice. And I feel like I'm really making a difference--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pops head into frame) Hey, wait a second. Holy cripes, Bonnie! Look at that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a discovery) Oh my sweet heaven-- Judy, are you a meter maid? Hopps is still wearing her vest, and her hat is on the ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Oh this? No! Oh, no no! This is just a temporary thing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the safest job on the force!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, she's not a real cop! Our prayers have been answered!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glorious day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meter maid, meter maid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Dad--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meter maid, meter maid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD! You know what-- it's been a really long day, I should really--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You get some rest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those meters aren't gonna maid themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eye roll) Buh-bye. She hangs up, defeated. The SELF-PITYING MUSIC comes up f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bunny! Turn down that depressing music!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the meter maid alone! Didn't you hear her conversation? She feels like a failure! Judy turns off the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to herself) Tomorrow's another day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it might be worse! Off Judy's exhausted look, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps, on meter maid duty, thunks a ticket on a windshiel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was 30 seconds over! Another meter dings, Hopps puts another ticket on a very small windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! Yeah you're a real hero, lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! Another ticket down. A MOTHER HIPPO picks up the ticket, her SMALL CHILD looks right at Hopps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mommy says she wishes you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un-cool, rabbit. My tax dollars pay your salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what has clearly been a series of these encounters, Hopps repeatedly bangs her head on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (less convinced with each utterance) I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Suddenly, a PIG bangs on the cart's window. Hopps startle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Bunny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rote) Sir, if you have a grievance, you may contest your citation in traffic court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? My shop! It was just robbed! Look, he's getting away! Well are you a cop or not? Hopps sees a WEASEL running with a bag of stolen goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping out of it) Oh, yes! Yes! Don't worry, sir, I got this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps jumps out and gives chase-- ditching her silly vest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop in the name of the law!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch me if you can, Cottontail! The chase is on. McHorn screeches up in his cop car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Coming through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Officer McHorn, we got a 10- 31. Hopps slides across his hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got dibs! Officer Hopps, I am in pursuit! Hopps chases the Weasel, who races through Savannah Centr As Hopps advances, the Weasel ducks into... LITTLE RODENT Thanks to her small size, Hopps follows him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving, but too big to enter) Hey! Metermaid! Wait for the real cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps emerges in Little Rodentia, teeming with tiny roden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Hopps spots the Weasel, who's using two mouse cars as ska She chases after him, smashing through Little Rodentia. A the Weasel jumps off the top of a mouse building, he knoc it over, but Hopps is able to save them from crashing. Resuming the chase, Hopps jumps off the building-- landin precariously in the midst of a large group of mice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Oh, sorry! Coming through! `Scuse me! `Scuse me. Pardon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps locates Weaselton, who's safely making his escape o the top of a tiny mouse train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon voyage, flat foot! But Hopps won't quit. She takes a short cut and knocks hi off the train. Rodents scream and run amidst the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop right there! The Weasel throws an ornamental donut at Hopps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a donut, coppah! But the donut misses and rolls towards some SHREWS coming of "Mousies."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmygawd, did you see those leopard print jeggings? (sees the donut about to kill her) Aaaaaaaaaaaagh! But at the last second... Hopps stops it! Deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw... thank you. Meanwhile, the Weasel spots the bag he was stealing and smugly picks it up, ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to papa... Then out of nowhere, Hopps dumps the donut on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is overflowing with ANIMALS filing MISSING MAMM REPORTS. Clawhauser is dealing with an otter, MRS. OTTERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're gonna have to be patient and wait in line just like everyone else, Mrs. Otterton, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then: BAM! The Weasel (in donut) rolls through the f door and hits Clawhauser's desk. It settles, revealing Ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I popped the weasel! Behind her, Chief Bogo yells from the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps sits in a big chair in front of Bogo, like a kid in principal's office. Bogo looks over a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoning your post, inciting a scurry, reckless endangerment of rodents... but to be fair, you did stop a master criminal from stealing two dozen... moldy onions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to disagree with you, sir, but those aren't onions. Those are a crocus varietal called Midnicampum Holicithias. They're a Class C Botanical, sir. I grew up in a family where plant husbandry was kind of a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your tiny mouth, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I got the bad guy. That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your job is putting tickets on parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, uh, Mrs. Otterton's here to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I just didn't know if you wanted to take it this time, she seems really upset--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I don't want to be a meter maid... I wanna be a real cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think the Mayor asked what I wanted when he assigned you to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, if you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life isn't some cartoon musical where you sing a little song and your insipid dreams magically come true. So let it go! MRS. OTTERTON barges in, with Clawhauser trailing, wheezi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bogo please-- five minutes of your time. Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, I tried to stop her, she is super slippery. I gotta go sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, as I've told you, we are doing everything we can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband has been missing for ten days. His name is Emmitt Otterton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a florist. We have two beautiful children. He would never just disappear. Mrs. Otterton reveals her own sweet little photo of Emmit with her and the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, our detectives are very busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. There's got to be somebody to find my Em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Otterton--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will find him. Mrs. Otterton races over to Hopps and gives her a big hug relief. Bogo looks to Hopps, ready to explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you! Bless you, bless you little bunny! (hands picture of family) Take this. Find my Emmitt. Bring him home to me and my babies. Please? Bogo grunts and ushers Mrs. Otterton back outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Otterton? Please wait out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Oh, thank you both so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second. He closes the door and turns to Hopps, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insubordination. Now, I'm going to open this door and you're going to tell that otter you're a former meter maid with delusions of grandeur who will not be taking the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogo opens the door, to find... Bellwether, hugging Mrs. Otterton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just heard Officer Hopps is taking the case!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant Mayor Bellwether...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (texting) The Mammal Inclusion Initiative is really starting to pay off! Mayor Lionheart is just gonna be so jazzed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No, let's not tell the mayor just yet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I sent it, and it is done, so I did do that. All right, well I'd say the case is in good hands! Us little guys really need to stick together! Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like glue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused laughter) Good one! Just call me if you ever need anything, okay? You've always got a friend at City Hall, Judy. Alright, bye bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am. Bogo forces a smile and closes the door, even more pissed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will give you 48 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two days to find Emmitt Otterton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, you strike out-- you resign. Hopps is taken aback by that for a moment... then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... okay... deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid. Clawhauser will give you the complete case file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clawhauser places the Otterton file on his desk for Hopps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here ya go! One missing otter! Hopps opens the file. It's a single piece of paper. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yikes! That is the smallest case file I've ever seen! Leads: none, witnesses: none-- and you're not in the computer system yet, so resources: none. (chuckles) I hope you didn't stake your career on cracking this one. Clawhauser takes a bite of his donut and the crumbs land picture in the file, drawing Hopps's attention to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (deep breath) "Last known sighting..." Hopps brushes away the crumbs, revealing a picture of Mr. Otterton on the street. Clawhauser annoyingly slurps from soda bottle. Hopps squints at the picture, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just borrow-- (grabbing soda bottle) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps uses Clawhauser's bottle to enlarge the picture. Sh sees Mr. Otterton holding a PAWPSICLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pawpsicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murder weapon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your pawpsicle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, `cause that... What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I... have a lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Nick pushing a BABY STROLLER. HOPPS zooms up in h traffic cart, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Hello? It's me again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Officer Toot Toot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fake laugh, humoring him) Ha-ha-ho, no actually it's Officer Hopps, and I'm here to ask you some questions about a case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, meter maid? Did someone steal a traffic cone? It wasn't me. Hopps looks ahead, Nick has gone around the corner. Hopps pulls in front of Nick and sounds her siren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Carrots, you're gonna wake the baby, I gotta get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is important, sir. I think your ten dollars worth of popsicles can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make 200 bucks a day, fluff. 365 days a year, since I was 12, and time is money, hop along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, just look at the picture. Hopps holds up the traffic cam picture of the Otter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sold Mr. Otterton that popsicle right? Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everybody. And I also know that somewhere there's a toy store missing its stuffed animal, so why don't you get back to your box. Hopps' ears droop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Then we'll have to do this the hard way. She puts a boot on the stroller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just boot my stroller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas Wilde, you are under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Howting your feewings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felony tax evasion. Nick smile drops a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 200 dollars a day... 365 days a year... since you were 12, that's two decades, so times twenty... (calculating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which is one million four- hundred sixty thousand-- I think, I mean I am just a dumb bunny, but we are good at multiplying-- anyway, according to your tax forms... (presenting the forms) ...you reported let me see here: zero. Unfortunately, lying on a federal form is a punishable offense. Five years jail time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's my word against yours. Hopps clicks a button on her CARROT PEN, which SPEAKS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "200 bucks a day, fluff. 365 days a year, since I was 12."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's your word against yours. And if you want this pen, you're going to help me find this poor missing otter or the only place you'll be selling popsicles is the prison cafeteria. (dramatic smirk) It's called a hustle, sweetheart. Nick is utterly speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hustled you. (rude laugh) She hustled you good! You're a cop now Nick, you're gonna need one of these! Have fun working with the fuzz! THWAP! Finnick slaps his JUNIOR OFFICER STICKER on Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is. I only saw where he went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not exactly a place for a cute little bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me cute. (forceful) Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mystic Spring Oasis is new agey, full of incense, etc meditating HIPPIE YAK sits with flies buzzing around his head, matching the tone of his ohm. Hopps enters with Nic and they approach the yak (still with his eyes closed).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooooooohmmmmmmmm. Oooooooooooohmmmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, hello. The yak continues his incessant chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, hello? Hello? HELLO?! The yak finally shakes out of his trance and notices Hopp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! My name is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo, you know, I'm gonna hit the pause button right there, `cause we're all good on Bunny Scout Cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no... I'm Officer Hopps, ZPD. I'm looking for a missing mammal, Emmitt Otterton. Right here-- (shows photo) --who may have frequented this establishment. The Yak looks at Hopps' picture. His eyes go wide, as if about to say something really important, and then:

dialogues.speaker: AH-CHOO
dialogues.text: (flies go everywhere) Yeah, Ol' Emmitt! Haven't seen him in a couple weeks. But hey, you should talk to his yoga instructor, I'd be happy to take you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you so much, I'd appreciate that more than you can imagine. It would be such a big-- (scream) You are naked! The Yak comes around the counter and he IS naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh for sure, we're a naturalist club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in Zootopia anyone can be anything. These guys... they be naked. Nick grins, Hopps isn't pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nangi's just on the other side of the pleasure pool. The Yak opens the doors to a POOL AREA, with tons of nake animals sunning themselves, playing in the pool, etc. Hop eyes nearly pop out of her head. Nick leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this make you uncomfortable? Because, if so, there's no shame in calling it quits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, that's the spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick revels in Hopps' discomfort over the nude animals everywhere. Lots of nude animals. Yax leads them, oblivio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, some mammals say the naturalist life is weird, but you know what I say is weird? Clothes on animals! Here we go. Nangi's engaging in a string of fairly evocative yoga pos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, Nangi's an elephant, so she'll totally remember everything. Hey Nangi, these dudes have some questions about Emmitt the Otter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Emmitt Otterton? Been coming to your yoga class for like 6 years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no memory of this beaver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an otter actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here a couple Wednesdays ago. `Member?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was wearing a green cable- knit sweater vest, and new pair of corduroy slacks. Oh, and a paisley tie. Sweet Windsor knot. Real tight. Remember that Nangi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nangi doesn't want to be bothered. And she's useless. Yax a gold mine, though! Hopps writes down everything he says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we both walked him out and he got into this big ol' white car with a silver trim? Needed a tune up. The third cylinder wasn't firing. `Member that, Nangi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't happen to catch the license plate number, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for sure. It was 29THD03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0, 3... Wow, this is a lot of great info, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told ya Nangi has a mind like a steel trap. I wish I had a memory like an elephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I had a ball. You are welcome for the clue. And seeing as how any moron can run a plate, I will take that pen and bid you adieu. As Nick reaches to take it, Hopps realizes something and leaves him hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plate... I can't run a plate... (frustrated grunt) I'm not in the system yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the pen please. Hopps gets an idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still withholding pen) What was it you said? "Any moron can run a plate?" Gosh... if only there were a moron around who were up to the task...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbit, I did what you asked, you can't keep me on the hook forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not forever. Why, I only have 36 hours left to solve this case. So can you run the plate or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I just remembered I have a pal at the DMV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the DMV, the "Department of Mammal Vehicle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash is the fastest guy in there, you need something done, he's on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so, we are really fighting the clock and every minute counts. (suddenly stops, alarmed) Wait. They're all sloths?! Unfortunately, every mammal working there is a... SLOTH. INSERT: SLOTH EMPLOYEES taking extraordinary amounts of t to do the simplest of tasks-- stapling, stamping, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said this was going to be quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faux innocence) What? Are you saying that because he's a sloth, he can't be fast? I thought in Zootopia anyone could be anything. Nick smiles. Hopps doesn't. They head to Flash's station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash, Flash, hundred yard dash! Buddy, it's nice to see ya. Flash doesn't respond. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to... (beat) (beat) see you... (beat) (beat) too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps looks like she's going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Flash, I'd love ya to meet my friend-- uh, darlin' I've forgotten your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fake smile, to Nick) Officer Judy Hopps, ZPD. (shows badge) How are ya? Flash doesn't respond... then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am... doing... just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as well... as... I can... be. What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to an impatient Hopps) Hang in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...can I... do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was hoping you could run a plate--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was hoping you could--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...today. Hopps pauses-- cautiously optimistic that he's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was hoping you could run a plate for us. We are in a really big hurry. Beat.   Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.    What's the... plate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Number? Hopps takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (several beats) 2... 9...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmhmm. 0, 3.
Flash is just about to say three, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Flash, wanna hear a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you call a three humped camel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... know... (beat) What... do... you call... a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three humped camel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three humped... camel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pregnant. Nick laughs at his own joke. Flash doesn't react, then finally raises his head with a smile and....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha... ha... ha... ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, yes very funny, very funny, can we please just focus on the task-- Flash slowly reaches over to the sloth next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Priscilla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Flash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call... a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A three humped camel? Pregnant! Okay, great, we got it, please just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... humped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggggggghhhhhhh--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow DOT-MATRIX printer spits out the address for CAR LICENSE PLATE NUMBER: 29THD03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantically reads) 29THD03-- it's registered to... Tundratown Limo Service? A limo took Otterton, and the limo's in Tundratown-- it's in Tundratown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to hustle, bud. I love ya. I owe ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, we gotta beat the rush hour and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go outside. It's night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps reach LEGITIMATE ENTERPRISE CAR SERVICE. H tries to open the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed. Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm. And I will betcha you don't have a warrant to get in. Hm? Darn it. It's a bummer. There's a big gated parking lot which is chained shut... they can see a few limos parking inside, covered in snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wasted the day on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam, I have a fake badge. I would never impede your pretend investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a pretend investigation! Look, see-- (showing picture of Otterton) See him? This otter is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then they should have gotten a real cop to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem? Does seeing me fail somehow make you feel better about your own sad, miserable life? Nick considers this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does. One hundred percent. (then) Now... since you're sans warrant, I guess we're done? Hopps considers this and sighs, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We are done. Here's your pen. Hopps then casually throws it over the fence behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! (staring at the pen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, you throw like a bunny, second, you're a very sore loser. (starts to climb) See ya later, Officer Fluff, so sad this is over, I wish I could've helped more. Nick jumps down onto the other side, but just as he reach for the pen, Hopps is suddenly right there and snatches i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, you don't need a warrant if you have probable cause, and I'm pretty sure I saw a shifty low-life climbing the fence, so you're helping plenty. Come on. Hopps cheerfully heads off. Nick watches her, not quite smiling, but he's starting to respect his opponent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps wipes snow off a back bumper: LICENSE PLATE 29THD03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29THD03... this is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the big door, which looks like it belongs on a refrigerator. As they snoop around, Hopps uses tweezers t pick up a clump of fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polar bear fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening glove box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What?! Hopps looks up, only to see Nick holding some JERRY VOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Velvety Pipes of Jerry Vole! But on CD? Who still uses CDs? As Hopps rolls her eyes and goes back to collecting clues Nick lowers the back partition and his eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrots...? If your otter was here... he had a very bad day. Hopps' flashlight reveals CLAW MARKS covering the back se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are... claw marks. You ever seen anything like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Through the fog on the floor Hopps spots a wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait. Look. They slink back into the back seat. Hopps opens up the wa to find a drivers license for Mr. Otterton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him. Emmitt Otterton. He was definitely here. What do you think happened? Nick spots a cocktail glass... it's etched with a "B."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now wait a minute... (then, suspicious) Polar bear fur... Rat Pack music... fancy cup... (suddenly terrified) I know whose car this is. We gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Whose car is it? Nick tries to put everything back the way he found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most feared crime boss in Tundratown. They call him Mr. Big and he does not like me, so we gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving, this is a crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's gonna be an even bigger crime scene if Mr. Big finds me here, so we're leaving right now! Nick ushers Hopps to the door, but opens it to find two b POLAR BEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faux excitement) Raymond! And, is that Kevin?! Long time no see. And speaking of no see, how about you forget you saw me? Huh? For old time's sake? The polar bears grab Nick and Hopps by their throats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a no. ...and yank them off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VROOM! A car whizzes by. Inside, Nick and Hopps sit nervo in the back seat, sandwiched between the polar bears-- on whom casually scrolls through Zoogle Photos on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do that made Mr. Big so mad at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I uh, I may have sold him a very expensive wool rug... that was made from the fur of a... skunk's butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed at Nick) Oh, sweet cheese and crackers. Pull out to reveal the car passing through the security g of a residential compound. A POLAR BEAR GUARD lets them i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps are shoved into a room that's right out of Godfather. A POLAR BEAR enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Is that Mr. Big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) No. Now an even BIGGER POLAR BEAR enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, frustrated) No. ...and then another. The BIGGEST POLAR BEAR yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gotta be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking stop talking stop talking-- The huge polar bear growls at Nick, then reveals a tiny c upon which sits... a TEENY, TINY ARCTIC SHREW... this is BIG. He sounds like Marlon Brando sped up to 78 rpm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Big, sir, this is a simple misunder- Mr. Big holds out a TINY FINGER for NICK to KISS HIS RING Nick painstakingly does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a simple misunderstanding. Mr. Big motions for Nick to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come here unannounced... on the day my daughter is to be married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well actually we were brought here against our will, so... (Mr. Big is not impressed) Point is, I did not know it was your car, and I certainly did not know about your daughter's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you, Nicky... I welcomed you into my home... we broke bread together... Gram-mama made you her cannoli. And how did you repay my generosity? With a rug... made from the butt of a skunk. A skunk butt rug. You disrespected me. You disrespected my gram-mama who I buried in that skunk butt rug. I told you never to show your face here again, but here you are, snooping around with this... (re. Hopps) What are you, a performer? What's with the costume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I am a c--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mime! She is a mime. This mime, cannot speak. You can't speak if you're a mime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am a cop. And I'm on the Emmitt Otterton case, and my evidence puts him in your car, so intimidate me all you want, I'm going to find out what you did to that otter if it's the last thing I do. Mr. Big considers this and makes that little grunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have only one request: say hello to Gram-mama. Ice `em! The Polar Bears snatch Nick and Hopps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa-- I didn't see nothing-- I'm not saying nothing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you never will-- The polar bears open a hidden door on the floor, revealin icy pool beneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! No no no! If you're mad at me about the rug I've got more rugs! Nick and Hopps are about to be dumped in, when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Daddy, it's time for our dance. (sees them trying to kill Nick) What did we say? No icing anyone at my wedding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to, baby. Daddy has to. (to Thugs) Ice `em. Nick and Hopps scream and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. WAIT! She's the bunny that saved my life yesterday. From that giant donut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bunny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (warm, whisper) I love your dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, thank you. Mr. Big motions for the Polar Bears to put Hopps down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put `em down. (then, to Hopps) You have done me a great service. I will help you find the otter. I will take your kindness... and pay it forward. Hopps and Mr. Big kiss on the cheeks. Nick stares at them What is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lavish celebration full of arctic animals dancing. We f Nick and Hopps at the head table, next to Mr. Big. They a eat TINY pieces of WEDDING CAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otterton is my florist. He's like a part of the family. He had something important he wanted to discuss. That's why I sent that car to pick him up. But he never arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he was attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... he attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otterton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otterton. He went crazy. Ripped up the car, scared my driver half to death and disappeared into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a sweet little otter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child, we may be evolved... but deep down we are still animals. Nick and Hopps trade a worried glance. OVER THE FOLLOWING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to find Otterton... talk to the driver of the car. His name's Manchas, lives in the Rainforest District. Only he can tell you more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps make their way across a mossy rope bridge above the forest floor. It leads to a moss-covered apartm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door of the DRIVER'S APARTMENT, they ring the bell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Manchas? Judy Hopps, ZPD. We just want to know what happened to Emmitt Otterton. Beat. The door creaks open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be asking... what happened to me. The door opens to the chain, revealing... MANCHAS is... a HUGE JAGUAR-- but he's been badly beaten up. He has a bla eye, and a scratches. Nick and Hopps are taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. A teensy otter... did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... happened? Off Manchas's look, we

dialogues.speaker: A FLASHBACK --
dialogues.text: Manchas is driving when he's attacked from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was an animal... down on all fours... he was a savage. The car spins out. Emmitt growls at Manchas then runs off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (haunted) There was no warning, he just kept yelling about the "night howlers." Over and over, "the night howlers..." Nick and Hopps share a subtle look-- they have no idea wh "night howlers" are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. So you know about the night howlers too? Good, good, good. Because the night howlers are exactly what we are here to talk about. (to Judy) Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. So, uh, you just open the door and tell us what you know and we will tell you what we know. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering) Okay. Manchas closes the door and starts to unlock a series of deadbolts. Judy gives Nick an impressed look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clever fox. There's a commotion inside, followed by a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Manchas? The door creaks open just an inch. Nick and Hopps seem startled... Hopps slowly pushes the door open, revealing Manchas in the center of the room, hunched over and grunt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you... okay? Hopps looks at Manchas. RAAAGH!!! Manchas turns, right at them. His eyes are dila he's turned savage! He's poised to pounce on Nick and Hop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. RUN! The Jaguar tears after them, he's deranged, primal. Nick Hopps run! The jaguar is closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!! Nick and Hopps run across the bridge. Manchas closes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump! They jump off the bridge to a lower branch. They duck int hollow log and Manchas follows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Head down! Hopps frantically picks up her police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hopps to dispatch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Clawhauser showing a handcuffed PERP a video on h phone of pop star Gazelle singing and dancing. A RED LIGH blinks on the desk phone, but Clawhauser ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with Gazelle? Greatest singer of our lifetime-- angel with horns-- okay, hold on, keep watching. Who's that beside her? Who is it? Reveal: Clawhauser is dancing on stage with Gazelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you are one hot dancer... (digitized robo-voice) ...BENJAMIN CLAWHAUSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joyous laughter) It's me! Did you think it was real? It looks so real! It's not. It's just a new app. (finally notices ringing phone) Hold on a second-- Clawhauser clicks the speaker button and--

dialogues.speaker: CLAWHAUSER
dialogues.text: Blue Rev. (mm/dd/yy)                  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAAGH! Manchas takes a swipe at Nick. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clawhauser, listen to me! We have a 10-91! Jaguar gone savage! Vine and Tu-junja! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tujunga! As they emerge from the log, Hopps slips, dropping her ra CLAWHAUSER (ON RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're sending back up! Hopps?

dialogues.speaker: HOPPS
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps run, sliding around a corner. Ahead is a gondola station. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Head to the skytrams! They run to the gondolas. Hopps darts out of Manchas' way but slips and is headed off the platform when she manages grab on-- dangling from the edge. Nick searches for her.. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in! Carrots? Carrots! He tries to hold on to the gondola for Hopps, who is struggling to pull herself back onto the platform. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! As the gondola pulls away, Nick tries to stop it to no av NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no! Nick backs up... the jaguar stalks him. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, one predator to another--                      * The jaguar charges, but before it gets Nick-- clank! It's yanked back in place. We see a HANDCUFF on its back paw, attached to a metal post. Hopps cuffed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I can tell you're a little tense, so I'm just gonna give you a little personal space-- The jaguar thrashes, knocking Nick and Hopps over the edg Hopps barely grabs a vine, but struggles to hold Nick in other hand. As Manchas growls at them from above, Nick lo at the abyss below. Hopps looks around, her mind racing. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbit, whatever you do, do not let go! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna let go! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you what? No, I said-- listen-- noooo! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two-- Hopps lets go, swinging them over to a netting of vines, of on top of each other. They can't believe they're alive They look at each other, stunned, relieved... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrots. You saved my life. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That's what we do at the ZP... (the branch snaps) Deeeeeeeeeeeee..... Nick and Hopps plummet. They are about to hit the ground, a vine attached to their legs stops them right before imp Woo! A convoy of police arrive, screeching in front of th Out steps... Bogo. Hopps smiles, the cavalry has arrived. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this should be good.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: Hopps leads the cops up to the canopy, full of confidence HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was just a missing mammal case, but it's way bigger. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
