dialogues.text: Mr. Otterton did not just disappear. I believe he and this jaguar, they... went savage, Sir. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing) Savage? This isn't the Stone Age, Hopps. Animals don't go savage. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so too, `til I saw this: Hopps pulls back some leaves to reveal: the jaguar is gon There is no sign of him... or his handcuffs. It's like it never happened. Hopps' eyes go wide. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He was right here... BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying it) The "savage" jaguar. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I know what I saw-- he almost killed us. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe any aggressive predator looks savage to you rabbits. (calls out, to cops) Let's go. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-- Sir, I'm not the only one who saw him! (to Nick) Nick! Hopps turns to Nick, but before he can explain: BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You think I'm going to believe a fox? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he was a key witness and I enlisted-- BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the last straw) Two days to find the otter... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOGO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: or you quit... that was the deal. Badge. Bogo extends his arm, waiting for Hopps to hand it over. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Sir, we... BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badge. Hopps looks at Bogo, then looks at her badge, she's about reach for it, when... NICK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no. Bogo stops, and glares at Nick. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say, fox? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, what I said was, "no." She will not be giving you that badge. Look, you gave her a clown vest and a three-wheel joke-mobile and two days to solve a case you guys haven't cracked in two weeks? Yeah, no wonder she needed to get help from a fox, none of you guys were gonna help her, were you? Hopps looks at Nick, stunned he's sticking up for her. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the thing Chief, you gave her the 48 hours, so technically we still have 10 left to find our Mr. Otterton... and that's exactly what we're gonna do, so if you'll excuse us... we have a very big lead to follow and a case to crack. Good day. Nick guides Hopps to a PASSING GONDOLA, motioning her in. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hopps? The gondola pulls away, leaving Bogo and the rest of the police watching, flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps and Nick both stare straight ahead. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never let `em see that they get to you. Hopps looks at Nick, a little surprised. Nick looks out. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, things do get to you... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I mean, not anymore. But I was small and emotionally unbalanced like you once. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Har-har. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (retreating into the memory) No, it's true. I think was 8, or maybe 9, and all I wanted to do was join the Junior Ranger Scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG NICK, tiny and cherubic, looks in the mirror. We se MOTHER's paws tying the scout kerchief around his neck. NICK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so, my mom scraped together enough money to buy me a brand new uniform because, by God, I was gonna fit in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Nick bounds down the sidewalk and up the stairs. NICK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if I was the only predator in the troop--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Nick enters a church basement, spots a GROUP OF PRE KIDS, all in scout uniforms. They wave him over. NICK (V.O.)(CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the only fox. MEAN KID ANIMAL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Nick! NICK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna be part of a pack. MEAN KID ANIMAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for initiation? YOUNG NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Pretty much born ready. They high five Nick. It looks promising and fun. NICK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so proud. Suddenly, a BIG KID turns off the lights. Other KIDS swit on FLASHLIGHTS, shining them on Nick like gestapo spotlig MEAN KID ANIMAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Now raise your right hand and deliver the oath. YOUNG NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, Nicholas Wilde, promise to be brave, loyal, helpful, and trustworthy. MEAN KID ANIMAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though you're a fox? YOUNG NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Then, a bunch of KID ANIMALS tackle Nick. Soon, all of th animals pile on, kicking and shoving him. YOUNG NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! What did I do wrong, you guys?! No! Please tell me, what did I do wrong?! With Nick pinned, the primary mean kid straddles him. Som hands him a MUZZLE. The mean kid snaps it on Nick's snout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muzzled) What did I do?! MEAN KID ANIMAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you thought we would ever trust a fox without a muzzle, you're even dumber than you look. Nick breaks free from the kids. Scrambles away from them fright. As they laugh, he races out the door. MEAN KID ANIMAL (O.S.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, is he gonna cry? Once out sight, Nick panics as he struggles to remove the muzzle. It won't come off. Finally-- painfully-- he pulls off and throws it to the ground. He collapses, weeping.

dialogues.speaker: THE GONDOLA --
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned two things that day. One, I was never gonna let anyone see that they got to me. Hopps looks at Nick, who avoids eye contact. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And two? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the world's only gonna see a fox as shifty and untrustworthy, there's no point in trying to be anything else. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, you are so much more than that... Hopps touches Nick's arm as the gondola pierces the cloud The city at dawn comes into view. It's gotten too real fo Nick. He abruptly changes the subject. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, look at that traffic down there. (putting on radio voice) How about we go out to Chuck in Traffic Central-- Chuck, how are things looking on the Jam Cams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, I'm glad you told me... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightbulb moment!) The Jam Cams...! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, it's okay... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-n-shh-shush! There are traffic cameras everywhere. All over the canopy. Whatever happened to that jaguar-- HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic cams would have caught it! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo! Hopps gives him a chuck on the arm, impressed. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sneaky, Slick. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However. If you didn't have access to the system before, I doubt Chief Buffalo Butt is gonna let you into it now. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then) No... But I have a friend at City Hall who might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find BELLWETHER trying to balance a stack of binders w struggling to keep pace with Mayor Lionheart, who is walk quickly in front of her. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? If we could just review these very important-- (almost drops binders) Sir? She almost steps on a LITTLE MOUSE LADY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo, I'm so sorry... sir?! LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I heard you, Bellwether. Just take care of it! (setting another binder atop her stack) Please. And clear my afternoon, I'm going out. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! But, sir, you do have a meeting with Herds and Grazing... sir, if I could just-- He continues through a door. Bellwether tries to follow, the door shuts on her, spilling the binders to the floor. BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, mutton chops. As Bellwether picks up her mess, Hopps and Nick appear. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant Mayor Bellwether? We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in Bellwether's cramped little office. Nick and Hop hover over her while she sits at her computer. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need to get into the traffic cam database. Nick subtly touches Bellwether's wool puff. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouths, to Hopps) So fluffy! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheep never let me this close. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just touch a sheep's wool...

dialogues.speaker: NICK HOPPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's like cotton candy.            Stop it! Judy swats Nick, but accidentally hits Bellwether's puff. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rainforest District, Vine and Tujunga. ANGLE ON the computer screen. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Traffic cams for the whole city. This is so exciting, actually. Well, you know, I never get to do anything this important. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're the Assistant Mayor of Zootopia. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm more of a glorified secretary. I think Mayor Lionheart just wanted the sheep vote... (then, cheerily) But he did give me that nice mug. She motions to a mug that reads World's Greatest Dad Assistant Mayor. BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels good to be appreciated. LIONHEART (INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smellwether?! Bellwether cringes. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fun little name he likes to use. I called him Lionfart once. He did not care for that, let me tell you. It was not a good day for me. (pressing intercom button) Yes, sir? LIONHEART (INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to cancel my afternoon?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. I better go -- (to Hopps, while leaving) Let me know what you find. It was really nice for me to be-- LIONHEART (INTERCOM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While we're young, Smellwether! Bellwether finally opens her big heavy door and leaves. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think when she goes to sleep she counts herself? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush. Okay, traffic cams... (looking at computer) Tujunga, Tujunga... we're in. Nick and Hopps watch the footage from the night before. W can see the jaguar going nuts. Then a BLACK VAN skids up, some WOLVES hop out. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these guys? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timberwolves. Look at these dumdums. The Wolves suddenly capture the jaguar with a net. Judy GASPS, shocked. Nick is unfazed. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betcha a nickel one of em's gonna howl. The wolves howl... NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there it is. What is it with wolves and the howling? It's like-- HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (light-bulb moment) Howlers! Night howlers! That's what Manchas was afraid of... wolves! The wolves are the night howlers. If they took Manchas... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I bet they took Otterton too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we gotta do is find out where they went. She clicks the monitor... but as the wolves drive off, th disappear through a tunnel and don't come out the other s HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Where'd they go? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if I wanted to avoid surveillance because I was doing something illegal-- which I never have-- I would use the maintenance tunnel 6B... which would put them out... He clicks on another camera. Nothing... then... the wolve emerge in the van. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...right there. Hopps looks at Nick, impressed. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look at you, Junior Detective. You know, I think you'd actually make a pretty good cop. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dare you. Hopps goes back to clicking... we track the wolves throug alleys and back roads. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acacia alley... Ficus underpass... South Canyon... HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're heading out of town... Where does that road go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The imposing CLIFFSIDE ASYLUM sits on the edge of a waterfall. Nick and Hopps, hidden on the side of the road spy from a hundred yards away. Nick and Hopps sneak up to the guard gate, where TWO WOLV are stationed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using elaborate hand signals, Nick motions he's going to sneak past first. He gets around the gate, but as he gets close... a wolf sniffs the air... he's onto him. Nick reaches around and grabs a piece of wood to use as a weapon. The wolf moves toward Nick... but before he reach him... Ooooooooooo! A distant howl grabs his attention. It's Hopps, cupping h mouth to make the howl sound distant. The wolf hears it a can't help but howl as well. Another guard approaches. WOLF GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, quit it, you're gonna start a howl. GARY THE WOLF GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't start it. (more howling off-screen) Oooooooo! WOLF GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooooooo! More wolves start to howl. Nick looks at Hopps, impressed HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Nick and Hopps use the distraction to jump the fence and sneak into the complex. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a clever bunny. Above, they notice a drainage pipe leading into the build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps emerge from the drain pipe into the creepy asylum. They're in a large, cavernous room, full of old MEDICAL EQUIPMENT. It's like a combination of an old hosp and a turn-of-the-century zoo. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like this was a hospital. Judy shines her light down a corridor, at the end of whic a metal door with a blue light shining within. Nick nears door, about to open it... the tension builds and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Hopps) You know, after you, you're the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps cautiously pushes the door open to reveal: a room w modern medical equipment. Nick pops up behind her. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. All clear. Hopps rolls her eyes and cautiously enters and looks arou HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this equipment is brand new... NICK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrots...? Nick points to the ground, which is scuffed with CLAW MAR HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claw marks... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Huge, huge, claw marks. I mean, what kind of-- RAAGH! A SAVAGE TIGER emerges behind the glass of a nearb cage, startling Nick and sending him running to Hopps. Hopps swivels her flashlight to reveal: dozens of reflect eyes. Nick and Hopps make their way down a long corridor cages, looking for the jaguar. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Manchas. He's still feral, on all fours and pacing in a cell. They continue on, passing three, four, five, cages until final in the last cage: a FERAL OTTER. It's EMMITT OTTERTON. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him. We found our otter. (to the otter, gently) Mr. Otterton, my name is Officer Judy Hopps. Your wife sent me to find you. We're gonna get you out of here now. Otterton screeches at her and lunges toward the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or not. Guess he's in no rush to get home to the Missus. Hopps looks back down the corridor of cells, counting. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...11, 12, 13, 14. Not including Manchas it's 14... (lightbulb) Chief Bogo handed out 14 Missing Mammal files... They're all here. All the missing mammals are right here. Before she can respond-- CLICK! A door starts to open, Ni and Hopps retreat, stuck next to a DARK CELL. LIONHEART (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! I don't want excuses, Doctor, I want answers. Reveal: Mayor Lionheart berating the BADGER DOCTOR by his side. He looks serious, intense, tired. BADGER DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor Lionheart, please, we're doing everything we can. Hopps whips out her phone, starts recording. LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Cuz I got a dozen and a half animals here who've gone off the rails crazy-- and you can't tell me why. Now, I'd call that awfully far from doing everything. BADGER DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, it may be time to consider their biology. LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean biology? BADGER DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only animals going savage are predators. We cannot keep it a secret. We need to come forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm... Great idea. Tell the public. And how do you think they're gonna feel about their mayor, who is a lion?! I'll be ruined! BADGER DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what does Chief Bogo say? LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bogo doesn't know. And we are going to keep it that way. Beep-beep-beep-- Hopps' parents call in. She frantically tries to silence her phone. LIONHEART (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's here! BADGER DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you need to go, now! (calls out) Security! Sweep the area! AN ALARM SOUNDS. The door to the cell Hopps and Nick are triggers shut. They notice WOLVES approaching. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! We're dead. We're dead. That's it. I'm dead. You're dead. Everybody's dead. This gives Hopps an idea. She looks at the HUGE TOILET. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you swim? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Can I swim? Yes, I can swim. Why? The Wolves storm in, searching for the intruders... and s the swirling water of a toilet disappearing down the drai Hopps and Nick fly through the water slide like tubes of sewer system, cascading over a waterfall. Both scream. Th land in the river below. Nick pop up first. He looks desperately for Judy. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrots?! Hopps?! Judy?! She emerges, gasping for breath, holding up the bagged ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta tell Bogo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BOGO'S PHONE: Gazelle and Bogo dance on stage. I the same app Clawhauser used earlier. GAZELLE (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you are one hot dancer... (robo-voice) ...CHIEF BOGO. Bogo is dancing along when, suddenly, Clawhauser bursts i CLAWHAUSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Bogo! BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilty) Not now! CLAWHAUSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, is that Gazelle? BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to silence his phone) No! GAZELLE (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Gazelle, and you are one hot dancer. CLAWHAUSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the app too?! (ecstatic) Oh, jeeeeez! BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clawhauser, can't you see I'm working on the missing mammal cases?! CLAWHAUSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes of course! About that, sir... Officer Hopps just called... She found all of `em. Bogo's eyes widen. GAZELLE (ON PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop cars and helicopters surround the asylum. Hopps, flan by Bogo and other COPS, leads Lionheart out of the buildi HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor Lionheart, you have the right to remain silent. Anything-- LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. I was trying to protect the city. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just trying to protect your job. LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Listen, we still don't know why this is happening. It could destroy Zootopia. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law... Nick hangs back, proudly flashing his Junior Detective ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogo addresses the press. Behind him, POSTERS of the Sava Animals-- each one MUZZLED. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemammals... 14 mammals went missing and all 14 have been found by our newest recruit, who will speak to you in a moment. But first, let me remind you-- Bogo's voice trails off in the background as Nick and Hop watch from the side. Hopps bites her nails, nervous. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrgh. I am so nervous... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, press conference 101: You wanna look smart? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer their question with your own question and then answer that question. Like this, "Excuse me. Officer Hopps, what can you tell us about the case?" (pretending to be Hopps) "Well, was this a tough case? Yes. Yes it was." You see? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be there with me. We did this together. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, am I a cop? No. No, I am not. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny you should say that, because I've been thinking... it would be nice to have a partner. She hands Nick an APPLICATION. Then-- click-- she holds o the carrot pen to him. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. In case you need something to write with. BOGO (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At twenty-two hundred hours, we found all these missing animals... Bellwether gestures to Judy to come up. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hopps, it's time. As Hopps goes, Nick smiles. He's touched... BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now, I'll turn things over to the officer who cracked the case. Officer Judy Hopps. Hopps takes a deep breath and steps up to the dais. PRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hopps! / Over here! / Here! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to a REPORTER) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you tell us about the animals that went savage? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the animals in question... (glances at Nick) Are they all different species? Yes. Yes they are. Nick smiles, gives a thumbs up. REPORTER 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so what is the connection? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all we know is that they are all members of the predator family. ANOTHER REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, predators are the only ones going savage? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is accu-- Yes, that is accurate. Yes... REPORTER 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Why is that happening? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still don't know-- More disappointed rumbling. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to appease) Ah, it may have something to do with biology. On Nick-- huh? The press reacts, too... big time. REPORTER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A biological component. You know, something in their DNA... REPORTER 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more aggressive) In their DNA? Can you elaborate on that, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. What I mean is, thousands of years ago... um... predators survived through their aggressive hunting instincts. For whatever reason, they seem to be reverting back to their primitive, savage ways. Nick doesn't like what he's hearing. REPORTER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they did. Nick looks at the posters of the muzzled animals and shak his head, disbelieving. FLASH BACK to his memory of being muzzled as a child. MEAN KID ANIMAL (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (during flashback) Aw, is he gonna cry. REPORTER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on Nick, as flashback ends) Officer Hopps, could it happen again? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is possible. So we must be vigilant. And we at the ZPD are prepared and are here to protect you... This sends the Press into an absolute frenzy. PRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will more mammals go savage? / What is being done to protect us? / Have you considered a mandatory quarantine on predators? Bellwether steps in, eager to put an end to the questions BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you Officer Hopps, uh, that's all the time that we have. No more questions... Bellwether ushers Hopps off stage. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you did fine. Hopps walks across the lobby to Nick, completely unaware she just started a controversy. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) That went so fast! I didn't get a chance to mention you or say anything about how we-- NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Oh, I think you said plenty. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic, hard) Clearly, there's a biological component? These predators may be reverting back to their primitive, savage ways. Are you serious? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just stated the facts of the case. I mean, it's not like a bunny could go savage... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. But a fox could? Huh? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, stop it. You're not like them. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's a them now? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. You're not that kind of predator. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind that needs to be muzzled? The kind that makes you think you need to carry around Fox Repellent? Hopps sighs guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, don't think I didn't notice that little item the first time we met. (escalating anger) So let me ask you a question. Are you afraid of me? (Hopps looks heartbroken) Do you think I might go nuts? Do you think I might go savage? Do you think I might try to... EAT YOU?! He lunges, like he's going to bite her. She flinches and unthinkingly puts her hand on the repellent. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, hurt) ...I knew it. Just when I thought somebody actually believed in me... He shoves the application at her. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably best if you don't have a predator as a partner. As he walks away, he takes off the sticker badge, crumple and tosses it away. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nick. Nick! REPORTER 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hopps! Were you just threatened by that predator? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's my friend. REPORTER 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't even trust our own friends? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not what I said! Please! REPORTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we safe? / Have any other foxes gone savage? But no one will listen. Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ANCHORS sit in front of a graphic: TUNDRATOWN TRAGEDY FEMALE BOBCAT NEWS ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More bad news in this city gripped by fear. News footage shows a CARIBOU being loaded into an ambulan Another shot shows a POLAR BEAR in a muzzle. FEMALE BOBCAT NEWS ANCHOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caribou is in critical condition, the victim of a mauling by a savage polar bear. This-- the 27th such attack-- comes just one week after ZPD Officer Judy Hopps connected the violence to traditionally predatory animals. MALE MOOSE NEWS ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, a peace rally organized by pop star, Gazelle, was marred by protest. The news story cuts to footage of THE PROTEST: Hopps is caught in the middle of the PROTEST trying to separate them. PIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to the forest, predator! LEOPARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from the savannah! GAZELLE gives a sound bite to a NEWS REPORTER. GAZELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zootopia is a unique place. It's a crazy, beautiful, diverse city where we celebrate our differences. (gestures to PROTESTERS in background) This is not the Zootopia I know. Gazelle's interview plays as VO over a series of shots: ON A SUBWAY: Hopps watches a MOTHER RABBIT bring her CHIL close as a LION gets on the train. GAZELLE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zootopia I know is better than this. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAZELLE (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't just blindly assign blame. We don't know why these attacks keep happening...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Mrs. Otterton watches her husband flail like a madman in padded room. Judy approaches her. GAZELLE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but it is irresponsible to label all predators as savages. MRS. OTTERTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my Emmitt. On Hopps-- a look of exhaustion and distress. BACK ON Gazzelle's interview-- GAZELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot let fear divide us. Please-- give me back the Zootopia I love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broadcast plays from Hopps' desk computer. As she watches, Bogo walks up behind her. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Hopps. The new Mayor wants to see us. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor? Why? BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would seem you've arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clawhauser sighs and closes his laptop. He loads it into box of his desk items. Hopps enters. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clawhauser? What're you doing? CLAWHAUSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, they thought it would be better if a predator such as myself wasn't the first face you that you see when you walk into the ZPD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CLAWHAUSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna move me to Records. It's downstairs. By the boiler. Hopps' face falls. Bogo waits for her in the background. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps! Off Hopps' heartbroken look, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTO of a SMILING HOPPS. Wider to reveal: The photo is a PAMPHLET that reads, ZPD: Integrity. Honesty. Bravery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps looks at the pamphlet. Bellwether sits across from at her desk. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I don't understand. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our city is 90% prey, Judy. And right now they're just really scared. You're a hero to them. They trust you. And so that's why Chief Bogo and I want you to be the public face of the ZPD. Bogo sits next to Hopps. She looks at the pamphlet again. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to find words) I'm not... I'm not a hero. I came here to make the world a better place, but I think I broke it. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give yourself so much credit, Hopps. The world has always been broken. That's why we need good cops-- like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, sir, a good cop is supposed to serve and protect-- help the city. Not tear it apart. (deep sigh) I don't deserve this badge. She removes her badge... BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, you've worked so hard to get here. It's what you've wanted since you were a kid. You can't quit... HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the opportunity. Hopps sets her badge on the desk and walks out. Bellwethe and Bogo look at one another in shock and concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps, with a thousand yard stare, works the carrot stand She wraps some carrots in a newspaper-- Headline: GROWING UNREST DIVIDES CITY-- and hands them to a RABBIT FAMILY. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen carrots. RABBIT MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day. RABBIT MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to daughter) Come on. Hopps reads the paper as Stu and Bonnie approach, concern STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Jude-- Jude the dude, remember that one? How we doin? HOPPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONNIE HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not fine. Your ears are droopy. Hopps remains fixed on the newspaper and lets out a sigh. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I think I could make a difference? STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're a trier, that's why. BONNIE HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've always been a trier. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I tried. And it made life so much worse for so many innocent predators. Off-screen, BEEP-BEEP. STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, not all of them, though. Speak of the devil. Right on time. A truck pulls up. Its sign reads: GIDEON GREY'S GOOD BAKE STUFF... With Fresh Produce From Hopps Family Farms. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that... Gideon Grey? STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. It sure is. We work with him now. BONNIE HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's our partner. And we never would have considered it had you not opened our minds. STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I mean, Gid's turned into one of the top pastry chefs in the tri-burrows. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really cool, you guys. GIDEON GREY, now paunchy, climbs out his truck. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon Grey. I'll be darned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADULT GIDEON GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Judy-- I'd like to say I'm sorry for the way I behaved in my youth. I had a lotta self-doubt that manifested itself in the form of unchecked rage and aggression. I was a major jerk. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I know a thing or two about being a jerk... ADULT GIDEON GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyhow-- I brought you all these pies. He holds out some pies. KID BUNNIES come tearing across t field, bee-lining for the pies. Stu shouts at the kids. STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kids! Don't you run through that midnicampum holicithias! RABBIT KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back the others) Whoa, whoa, whoa! ADULT GIDEON GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a 4-dollar word, Mr. H. My family always just called them night howlers. Wait. What? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, what did you say? Stu gestures to the flowers growing on the edge of the cr STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Gid's talking about those flowers, Judy. I use `em to keep bugs off the produce. But I don't like the little ones going near `em on account of what happened to your Uncle Terry. BONNIE HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Terry ate one whole when we were kids and went completely nuts. STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bit the dickens out of your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a dawning realization) A bunny can go savage... We stay on Hopps as she pieces it together. BONNIE HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Savage? Well, that's a strong word. But it did hurt like the devil. STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sure it did. There's a sizable divot in your arm. I'd call that savage. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if doing an equation) Night howlers aren't wolves. They're flowers. The flowers are making the predators go savage. That's it! That's what I've been missing! Hopps races away, then turns back. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, keys! Keys! Keys! Keys! Hurry! Come on! Thank you, I love you bye! Stu tosses her the keys to his pick-up. Hopps jumps into truck, peels out, leaving Stu and Bonnie in the dust. STU HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You catch any of that, Bon? BONNIE HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one bit. GIDEON GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that makes me feel a little better. I thought she was talking in tongues or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps drives the farm truck to Finnick's van. She knocks. FINNICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find Nick. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finnick gives her a reluctant look, then softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps arrives at an underpass. She looks around, it's a desolate, sad place. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick? Nick! There's Nick, sitting on a lawn chair under the bridge. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Nick! Night howlers aren't wolves. They're toxic flowers. I think someone is targeting predators on purpose and making them go savage. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Isn't that interesting. He gets up, walks under the bridge. She follows. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait, please-- I know you'll never forgive me. And I don't blame you. I wouldn't forgive me either. I was ignorant and irresponsible and small-minded... But predators shouldn't suffer because of my mistakes. I have to fix this, but I can't do it without you. He sighs, but still won't look at her. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting emotional) And after we're done, you can hate me, and that'll be fine, because I was a horrible friend and I hurt you... and you can walk away knowing you were right all along, I really am just a dumb bunny. It seems she lost him, then: HOPPS (ON RECORDER) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really am just a dumb bunny. I really am just a dumb bunny. Hopps cocks her head. Huh? Nick turns to her... holding h recording pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Carrots, I'll let you erase it... in 48 hours. Hopps sniffles and wipes a tear from her eye. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, get in here. Hopps leans her head on Nick's chest. He gives her a hug. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Oh, you bunnies... You're so emotional. There we go. Deep breath. (then) Are you just trying to steal the pen. Is that what this is? (then) You are standing on my tail, though. Off, off, off. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps drives as Nick sits shotgun-- eating blueberries. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you guys only grew carrots. (then, eats) What's the plan? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are gonna follow the night howlers. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. How? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows picture of weasel) Know this guy? NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I told you, I know everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find the weasel selling crappy knock-off merchandise o street corner. DUKE WEASELTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello, step right up! Anything you need... I got it. All your favorite movies! I got movies that haven't even been released yet! An ARMADILLO CUSTOMER scans an array of blatant knock-off movies like "Wreck-it Rhino," "Wrangled," and "Pig Hero 6 DUKE WEASELTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, 15% off! 20! Make me an offer! Come on! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly appearing) Well, well, look who it is. The duke of bootleg. DUKE WEASELTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you, Wilde? Shouldn't you be melting down a popsicle or something? (sees Hopps) Hey, if it isn't Flopsy the Copsy. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know those weren't moldy onions I caught you stealing. What were you gonna do with those night howlers, Wessleton? DUKE WEASELTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Weaselton. Duke Weaselton. And I ain't talking, rabbit. And ain't nothing you can do to make me. Weaselton flicks a toothpick in her face. Hopps smiles at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MR. BIG'S PLACE
dialogues.text: We find polar bears holding the weasel over the ice pit. MR. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUKE WEASELTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaagh! Agh! (to Nick) Ya dirty rat! Why ya helping her?! She's a cop! MR. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the godmother to my future granddaughter. Reveal: FRU FRU is pregnant. FRU FRU SHREW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna name her Judy. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw. MR. BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to polar bears) Ice this weasel. DUKE WEASELTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right, please! I'll talk! I'll talk. I stole them night howlers so I could sell `em. They offered me what I couldn't refuse... Money. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to whom did you sell them? DUKE WEASELTON (PRE-LAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ram named Doug. We got a drop spot underground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps approach an abandoned subway station. DUKE WEASELTON (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Just watch it. Doug is the opposite of friendly. He's unfriendly... They arrive at the entrance and quickly sneak under the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge on a platform and spot an abandoned subway ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! As they sneak up to it... Hopps pulls open the window and looks inside the car. They both jump into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both see the rows of night howlers. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weasel wasn't lying. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, looks like old Doug's cornered the market on night howlers... Click! A door opens off screen! They quickly hide under a desk as a TOUGH SHEEP LABWORKER enters. He goes through the process of harvesting the pollen, eventually producing a small, blue paint ball pellet of n howler toxin. Nick and Hopps watch it all. The Sheep's phone RINGS. DOUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You got Doug here. What's the mark? Cheetah in Sahara Square. Got it. The Sheep loads a gun, cocks it. We see a MAP with pictur of a various animal targets. DOUG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Serious? Yeah, I know they're fast. I can hit him. Listen, I hit a tiny little otter through the open window of a moving car. Hearing this, the pieces of the puzzle start falling into place for Hopps. She looks up at the picture of Otterton- FLASHBACK to see Doug hitting him with a serum pellet. Th Hopps looks at Manchas's picture-- we FLASHBACK to that. DOUG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah I'll buzz you when it's done. Or you'll see it on the news. Ya know, whichever comes first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM, BAM, BAM! The goons have returned. WOOLTER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Doug, open up! We've got your latte. DOUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Alright, Woolter and Jesse are back, so I'm leaving now. (then) Out. Hopps looks around, what is she going to do. As Doug goes the door to unlock it, Hopps creeps out of their hiding s NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! Where are you going? Get back here! What are you doing?! He's gonna see you! What are you looking at? Hey! Whatever you're thinking, stop thinking it. Carrots! Carrots! DOUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It better have the extra foam this time-- BAM! Hopps kicks Woolter in the back, knocking him into t other two Thugs. Hopps locks the door. WOOLTER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, open up! The Thugs start banging on the doors. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! You just trapped us in here! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get this evidence to the ZPD. Nick picks up the case. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Great. Here it is. Got it. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. All of it! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps rushes to the control room, tries to start the engi NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, you're a conductor now? Hey, listen-- It would take a miracle to get this rust-bucket going. The train starts moving. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Hallelujah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) We kinda got a situation at the lab... (noticing train) Oh! It just got worse! Doug and his minions race after the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps race away, feeling fairly confident. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished. Would it be premature for me to do a little victory toot-toot? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. One toot-toot. Nick blows the train whistle. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can cross that off the bucket list. Things are looking up, when: BAM! Woolter just busted into the car. Nick slams the doo closed right before Woolter gets to them. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have to rescind that victory toot-toot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noise from the roof above them... BAM! BAM! BAM! NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's just hail? Uh-oh. Jesse busts through the window. He's stuck, but flailing at Hopps. Nick tries to pull him away. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off! Nick gets punched backward and notices Woolter charging toward the door at full speed. Right before Woolter arriv Nick pulls the door open. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming! Woolter's momentum carries him into Jesse-- dislodging hi onto the tracks. Hopps is knocked out the window, but gra onto Woolter's horn. Hopps tries to hang on as the subway hurtles down the tunnel. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrots?! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Don't stop! Keep going! JESSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to get run over) No! No! Please stop! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not stop this car! Jesse dives to safety and Hopps gets bucked up onto the t of the train. Nick takes the wheel as the train emerges a ground. Hopps looks up to see... Another train coming tow them... on the same track! She sees a turn-off switch ahe HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed up, Nick! Speed up! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staving off Woolter) There's another train coming! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me! SPEED! UP! Woolter sees the train coming and tries to get unstuck, b he can't. He struggles like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOOLTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the train! Hey! Then, at the last second, Hopps appears next to him: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Need some help? Hopps kicks Woolter off the train and he lands perfectly the turn-off switch on the tracks below. At the last poss second, their train switches tracks-- just avoiding the oncoming car. Except... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! Oh no, no, no! Too fast! Hold on! The train derails as it takes the curve. The night howler catch fire. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is our stop! Hopps and Nick dive out of the car and onto a subway platform... Just as the lab car EXPLODES. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Maybe some of the evidence survived. A second loud EXPLOSION. The train is destroyed. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is gone. We've lost it all. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking head) Yeah. Oh, except for this. Nick holds up a case-- containing a gun and a pellet. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Nick! Yes! Judy SMACKS him on the arm. Hard. Nick grimaces. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! We gotta get to the ZPD. Cut through the Natural History Museum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Hopps race through the empty museum. The ZPD entrance is just ahead. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! There it is! They're going to make it. BELLWETHER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy! Judy! Judy and Nick stop and turn. There's Bellwether, standing behind them with TWO RAM COPS. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor Bellwether! (out of breath, rapidly) We found out what's happening. Someone's darting predators with a serum-- that's what's making them go savage. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (applauding) I am so proud of you, Judy. You did just a super job. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am. (troubling realization) How did you know where to find us? BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go ahead and I'll take that case now. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what... I think Nick and I will just take this to the ZPD... Hopps turns toward the ZPD. Uh oh. One of Bellwether's RA is blocking the way. Nick just now gets what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: HOPPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run!                            Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take off-- away from the ZPD-- down a dark corridor. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them! Hopps looks over her shoulder as she runs-- not seeing a sharp WOOLY MAMMOTH TUSK sticking out. It slashes her leg knocking her off her feet. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach! NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah Carrots! Nick goes to her. Her leg is bleeding badly. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got ya, come here, come here. He carries her behind a pillar. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now just relax. Nick digs a handkerchief from his pocket. A few BLUEBERRI fall out with it. NICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops... Blueberry? HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass. BELLWETHER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on out, Judy! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the case. Get it to Bogo. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna leave you behind. That's not happening. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, we'll think of something. Bellwether finally appears, flanked by the Rams. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the same team, Judy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH BELLWETHER & THUGS -- Bellwether talks as they look for Hopps and Nick... BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underestimated. Under-appreciated. Aren't you sick of it? Predators. They may be strong and loud, but prey out-number predators 10 to one. Bellwether sees a SHADOW-- RABBIT EARS. She gestures to t RAMS-- there they are. BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it-- 90 percent of the population, united against a common enemy. We'll be unstoppable. The Rams are about to pounce on Hopps and Nick... only to find the shadow is coming from a MUMMIFIED JACKALOPE bein illuminated by a shop light. BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Goons) Over there! Hopps and Nick are making a run for it. They're going to it to the ZPD! When suddenly... BAM! A RAM tackles them both, knocking the case out of Ni paws. Both of them fall into a sunken diorama. Bellwether with case in hand, looks over the edge. BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you should have stayed on the carrot farm, huh? It really is too bad; I really did like you. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Kill me? BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Of course not... he is. Bellwether takes the dart gun out of the case, aims at Ni and... THWICK! She darts him. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Nick?! Nick starts to shake and crouch. Bellwether dials her pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, police! There's a savage fox in the natural history museum. Officer Hopps is down! Please hurry! Nick is starting to turn. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nick, don't do this. Fight it. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but he can't help it, can he? Since preds are just biologically predisposed to be savages. Nick stalks Hopps, who tries to limp away. BELLWETHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, think of the headline: "Hero Cop Killed By Savage Fox..." HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it, prey fears predator, and you stay in power? BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, pretty much. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear always works. And I'll dart every predator in Zootopia to keep it that way. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Nick stalks her) Oh, Nick! No! BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-Bye, Bunny. Nick lunges. He attacks. Hopps screams. Bellwether smiles HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood, blood, blood! And death. Bellwether looks confused. Nick stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you're milking it. Besides, I think we got it, I think we got it. We got it up there, thank you yakkety-yak-- you laid it all out beautifully. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Bellwether looks at her gun, in disbelief. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea, oh, are you looking for the serum? (holds it up) Well, it's right here. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you've got in the weapon there- - those are blueberries. From my family's farm. Livid, Bellwether sees a blueberry in the gun's chamber. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are delicious. (licking fingers) You should try some. BELLWETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I framed Lionheart, I can frame you too! It's my word against yours! HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo, actually-- Hopps holds up the carrot pen. BELLWETHER (ON CARROT PEN RECORDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll dart every predator in Zootopia to keep it that way... HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --It's your word against yours. It's called a hustle, sweetheart. Boom. Bogo and a TEAM OF COPS burst onto the scene. Bellwether looks to run but there's nowhere to go. She's nailed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PREDATOR-PREY news team reads the headlines. FOOTAGE sh Bellwether being led to jail in cuffs and an orange jumps PREDATOR ANCHOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Former Mayor Dawn Bellwether is behind bars today, guilty of masterminding the savage attacks that have plagued Zootopia of late. PREY ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her predecessor, Leodore Lionheart, denies any knowledge of her plot, claiming he was just trying to protect the city. A FELINE REPORTER, KITTY COWLICK, interviews Lionheart. LIONHEART

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I falsely imprison those animals? Well, yes. Yes I did. It was a classic "doing the wrong thing for the right reason" kind of a deal.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE NEWS DESK --
dialogues.text: PRED ANCHOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In related news, doctors say the night howler antidote is proving effective in rehabilitating the afflicted predators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Otterton, who wakes up into the arms of his wife. MRS. OTTERTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmitt? Oh... Emmitt... She hugs him and he holds her tight. We pull back to reve Hopps in the room, watching their reunion. MRS. OTTERTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hopps) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps walks through the CENTRAL PLAZA of ZOOTOPIA. She lo around to see animals coming back together. She focuses o two KIDS: one pred, one prey playing soccer. HOPPS (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, I thought Zootopia was this perfect place where everyone got along and anyone could be anything... Hopps kicks the soccer ball with the kids. HOPPS (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out, real life's a little bit more complicated than a slogan on a bumper sticker. Real life is messy. AT THE ZPD: Hopps enters to find Clawhauser back at his d unpacking. What's more-- TWO COPS approach him with donut HOPPS (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have limitations. We all make mistakes. Which means-- hey, glass half full!-- we all have a lot in common. And the more we try to understand one another, the more exceptional each of us will be. But we have to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal: Hopps is giving a commencement address to the GRADUATES of the Police Academy. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, no matter what type of animal you are, from the biggest elephant to our first fox... Reveal: Nick is a cadet. He removes his shades, winks at Hopps. HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I implore you... try. Try to make the world a better place. On stage, Hopps readies to pin a BADGE on Nick. As she approaches, they exchange a nod-- a small, sincere gestur She places the badge, then gives Nick an official salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look inside yourself, and recognize that change starts with you. It starts with me. It starts with all of us. Caps are thrown in the air. The music fades out, leaving the APPLAUSE, which is interrupted by: BOGO (PRE-LAP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps and Nick (now in uniform) sit together among ZPD's finest. Bogo stands at the podium. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Enough! Shut it! We have some new recruits with us this morning, including our first fox. Who cares. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! You should have your own line of inspirational greeting cards, sir. BOGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, Wilde. Assignments! Officers Grizzoli, Fangmeyer, Delgato: Tundratown Swat. Snarlov, Higgins, Wolfard: Undercover. Hopps, Wilde... (beat of anticipation) Parking duty. Dismissed. (beat) Just kidding! We have reports of a street racer tearing up Savannah Central. Find him, shut him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopps drives. Nick rides shotgun, eating a Pawpsickle. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are all rabbits bad drivers or is it just you? She slams on the brakes. He lurches forward, accidentally jamming the Pawpsickle into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. Sorry. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he wipes off his face) Sly bunny. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb fox. NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you love me. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know that? Yes. Yes, I do. They smile wide. They're stopped at a red light, when suddenly-- a TRICKED OUT RED SPORTS CAR blasts through th light! They look at each other and smile even wider. Hopps stomps on the gas. Nick hits the siren. The patrol takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fleeing sports car comes to a screeching halt. ANGLE the license plate: FST NML. Hopps and Nick exit their car approach the driver. HOPPS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you were going 115 miles per hour. I hope you have a good explanation. But when they get to the driver's window... NICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash? Flash? Hundred yard dash?! Yep. It's Flash the sloth. FLASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (several beats) Nick.
